result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter J Schaab was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------------

with Huber privileges to commence on or before 06/14/2016 at 8:00 a.m.
---------------------------------

Restitution paid up front in full and disbursed through Attorney Kramer's trust account.
---------------------------------

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter J Schaab

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
8:35 am Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Atty Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Peter J Schaab in court with Atty Stephen R Kramer.  
Atty Kramer advises Court that they have agreement with regard to sentence and recites terms.  
Mr. Schaab is to pay court costs only; restitution up front which has been paid in full and disbursed to the victim through Atty Kramer's trust account.  
There is an agreement for a 30 day jail sentence with Huber privileges.  
Atty Leusink makes record with regard to victim notification.  
Atty Kramer provides court with a copy of the letter sent by him to the victim with his trust account check for the restitution.  
Defendant does not wish to make a statement.  
Court imposes the sentence agreed to by the parties.  
Jail turn in date:  On or before June 14, 2016 at 8:00 a.m.   
8:38 am  Court in recess.
Sentencing hearing at 04-15-2016 08:30 am
Stipulation and Order as to Restitution

Defendant Peter J Schaab in court with attorney Stephen Richard Kramer.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Court in session at 10:32. Defendant in court with attorney Stephen Kramer. Haley Jo Johnson appears for the State of Wisconsin with victim. Attorney Kramer requesting an adjournment. Attorney Johnson responds to requests. Court grants continuance. Discussion regarding restitution request and documents to be provided. Records to be provided with in 2 weeks. Matter continued to Wednesday, February 10, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.
Restitution hearing at 01-20-2016 10:30 am
Defendant's Motion to Set Restitution and For Discovery
of Restitution Hearing
Status conference at 01-29-2016 01:15 pm

Defendant Peter J Schaab in court with attorney Stephen Richard Kramer.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant Peter J Schaab in court with attorney Stephen R. Kramer.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Peter J Schaab in court with attorney Stephen R. Kramer.  Cody John Horlacher appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Peter J Schaab in court with attorney Stephen R. Kramer.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorneys advise the Court that this matter will not proceed to trial.  They expect to have an agreement and request a further status conference be scheduled.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Subpoena- T.H.
Subpoena- B.E.

Final pre-trial at 10-01-2015 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person at 10-05-2015 08:30 am.

Defendant Peter J Schaab in court with attorney Stephen R. Kramer.  Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Peter J Schaab in court with attorney Stephen R. Kramer.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 10:00 a.m..  Status conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Peter J Schaab in court with attorney Stephen R. Kramer.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Exhibit stored in file.

Defendant Peter J Schaab in court with attorney Stephen R. Kramer.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. Minutes filed.  Arraignment scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):NO CONTACT WITH PROVISUR TECHNOLOGIES OR ANY OF ITS EMPLOYEES OR THE LOCATION OF THIS BUSINESS.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Peter J Schaab in court with attorney Stephen R. Kramer.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
